column5: Looking for advice on a drive to resort for this summer. Taking my 83 yr old dad so smaller lakes is a must and I prefer a short distance from fort francis, maybe an hour or two. We are c&r walleye guys. Thanks guys!

For a smaller lake I liked Cedar Lake. About 6500 acres I believe. Was there 2 years ago in Mid July and did real well on walleyes. Stayed at Clarks Northern Lights. Some of our best walleye fishing was within sight of the camp. Reasonable prices, nice accommodations and free minnows is a bonus. Would definitely recommend them. Probably around 3 hours from Ft. Frances. -Chris
Iam with 1/4 oz.great lake, great camp.

I like cedar lake also but that's a longer drive than you suggested. I like cedar point resort the best location on the lake. I was thinking it's not a small lake but you could go with Youngs camp in Stevens bay on lake of the woods. You can get into some great fishing in that bay for walleye and smallmouth. Its really sheltered so you can make it like a small lake or expand out and leave the bay make it a bigger lake?

Lac des Mille Lac in Upsala, Ont.Huge lake but almost the entire NW corner is less than 1 mile across.Plenty of fishing within 2 miles of http://www.lacdesmille.com/index.htmlhttps://www.google.com/maps/@48.8829...5022868,11.67zMore resorts a little bit further east.smallies, walleye, and northern.Not high end luxury, but nice facilities.

We spent 2 weeks in the spring and 2 weeks in the fall, and we had a great trip both dates. It's on Perrault lake and the fishing was outstanding, very nice camp, top notch equipment and the best part, it's owned by Americans, who didn't give our group the bum's rush (can't wait to get you out of camp) so we can close up! Fired the last 2 Canadian camps we stayed at, when you're a LOW maintaince group and spending a lot of money, I don't need a attitude to go with my stay.Manotak Lodge were real pros and rebooked for 2016, and they were AMERICANS without the "tude"..
Me thinks I know who has the "tude" .....dude....

Think its deeper than that.cant stand people that gripe about some holiday that didnt go there way.And then gripe about"canadian owners".I Know a lot of camp owners and one thing for sure there arent a lot canadians.The ones that are all run good camps.Are you sure the were canadian lets have a name,
